content:
Considering that use of Π for dependent functions was removed in Lean 4, is there a particular reason why Σ for dependent products still a thing? Particularly as there's the alternative ×-based notation for dependent products.
It feels somewhat type-theory-centric to me to reserve Σ for dependent products.
Isn't the × notation pretty terrible when the types are long and you don't want to spell them out?
That's still quite longer than Σ a, b a.
